metadata.title: CVE-2012-3419 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Performance Co-Pilot (PCP) before 3.6.5 exports some of the /proc filesystem, which allows attackers to obtain sensitive information such asproc/pid/maps and command line arguments.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-3419` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcp-gui2 - 3.8.12ubuntu1
libpcp-import-perl - 3.8.12ubuntu1
libpcp-import1 - 3.8.12ubuntu1
libpcp-logsummary-perl - 3.8.12ubuntu1
libpcp-mmv-perl - 3.8.12ubuntu1
libpcp-mmv1 - 3.8.12ubuntu1
libpcp-pmda-perl - 3.8.12ubuntu1
libpcp-pmda3 - 3.8.12ubuntu1
libpcp-trace2 - 3.8.12ubuntu1
libpcp3 - 3.8.12ubuntu1
pcp - 3.8.12ubuntu1
pcp-import-collectl2pcp - 3.8.12ubuntu1
pcp-import-iostat2pcp - 3.8.12ubuntu1
pcp-import-mrtg2pcp - 3.8.12ubuntu1
pcp-import-sar2pcp - 3.8.12ubuntu1
pcp-import-sheet2pcp - 3.8.12ubuntu1
pcp-testsuite - 3.8.12ubuntu1
python-pcp - 3.8.12ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pcp package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.8.12ubuntu1').
